intro: Quamoclit sanguinea, commonly known as the blood-red orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, vivid red petals and sepals, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in the understory of rainforests. Its flowers bloom in clusters, producing a dense, showy display that attracts various pollinators. The botanical features of Quamoclit sanguinea make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
